description.narrative: The activities are 2-day training about legal aid and assistance, about the system of penalties and the new Criminal Procedure Code for AREDDHO?s volunteers, discussion sessions for the prison authorities, judges and legal officers and for police officers assist the judiciary, Information and training sessions for minors and other prisoners, legal aid, mediation solutions, drafting complaints and assisting the applicants in acting with the regulatory bodies, The study of the violations of human rights agai nst minors taking place in prisons of Bubanza and Bururi. In the Burundian prisons arbitrary arrest, prolonged pre-trial detention and improper handling of cases are common. The judicial authorities and the police often do not know how to deal with the cas es of minors properly and they often prevent the access of the families of detainees and lawyers' organizations to the detainees. Also the poverty of the accused, as well as the judiciary lack of resources, corruption and inefficiency hamper or prevent the investigation of legal cases is, the use of defenders of witnesses, the pre-trial detention legally staying within the limits of time, as well as the appeal process is operational. Prisoners and detainees conditions are poor, even life-threatening and mi nor prisoners are in particularly vulnerable position, as they have not been separated from the other prisoners. What represents a positive development, however, is that in April 2013 was adopted a new Criminal Procedure Code, which has taken more account of the prosecution service, pre-trial investigation and coercive measures, legal aid, the weaknesses of the right to prosecution of the prosecutor and the accused. The main objective of the project is to contribute to the implementation legal rights of the prisoners, particularly minor prisoners. The project's main target group consists of the prisoners in pretrial detention in Bururi and Bubanza. The project aims to provide legal advice and assistance to minor prisoners (in particular, the poor, the illite rate prisoners, albinos, batwa, as well as prisoners, which litigation is significantly delayed). In addition, the project will benefit from a wider target other prisons, prisoners, prison and judicial authorities as well as AREDDHOn volunteers who have le gal training during the project.
